sentences.english: It would be unwise to consider any of these as existing in isolation.
sentences.chinese: 只是孤立地考虑其中任何一项因素都将是不智之举。

sentences.english: It is unwise foranoutsider obtrude his opinions into a family quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 局外人硬把自己的想法加入一场家庭争论中是不智的。

sentences.english: It is unwise for an outsider to obtrude his opinions into a family quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 局外人硬把自己的想法加入一场家庭争论中是不智的。

sentences.english: Davis is a power in this firm, it would be unwise to quarrel with him.
sentences.chinese: 戴维斯在公司里很有势力，与他争吵是不智之举。

sentences.english: His foolishness resulted in permanent damage to his health.
sentences.chinese: 这不智之举令他的健康受到无法挽回的损害。

sentences.english: What is not wisdom is danger.
There is to be a meeting of the Great Powers.
sentences.chinese: 势力，与他争吵是不智之举。

sentences.english: You cannot keep out of trouble by spending more than your income.
sentences.chinese: 用超过收入的支出来解决问题是不智之举。

definition: variant of 魯莽|鲁莽[lu3 mang3]
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
to fail to see the larger issue (idiom)/to fail to grasp the big picture
to show no understanding of the times (idiom); cannot adapt to current circumstances/not amenable to reason
not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
to court disaster (idiom)/to dig one's own grave
facing a powerful enemy (idiom); fig. confronting grave difficulties/Enemy at the Gates, 1991 movie by Jean-Jacques Annaud
lit. to strike a stone with egg (idiom); to attempt the impossible/to invite disaster by overreaching oneself
lit. to go to war without just cause (idiom)/to act without justification
lit. to let the tiger return to the mountain; fig. to store up future calamities
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
